name: Hard Curse of the Blonde Bombshells Quiz / Test | Celebrities | 10 Questions

questions.text: Marilyn Monroe is perhaps the most famous example of a Hollywood blonde beauty with insurmountable problems. She dominated movies in the fifties - but died in her mid-30s in 1962. One of her fears was of "going crazy" or being institutionalized. Why?
questions.correct: It  had happened to her mother
options: It had happened to her sister
It had happened to her father
It had happened to her first husband
questions.explanation:
It  had happened to her mother.

	Dead in her 30s - under extremely mysterious circumstances, Marilyn's career hit the heights. Unfortunately, her problems were equally impressive - and took her in the opposite direction. The life of Marilyn's mother was the unstable source of the "going crazy" fear.Murder, suicide or accident for Marilyn?

questions.text: Marilyn's contemporary, Jayne Mansfield found fame and success in the 1950s and 60s to be more elusive. Which of the following is true of Jayne's fatal car crash in 1967?
questions.correct: She was one of many passengers in the car
options: She was not alone in the car, but was the driver
She was alone in the car
She was the only passenger in the car
questions.explanation:
She was one of many passengers in the car.

	Mansfield was a passenger - as were her kids (in the back seats of the car). She never quite made it to the top.

questions.text: Before Marilyn or Jane, there was Jean Harlow, who had a brief but highly successful career before her death in 1937 (at the age of 26). Who was primarily responsible for delaying Harlow's medical treatment until it was too late?
questions.explanation:
Her mother.

	Her mother was instrumental in causing the delay that cost Harlow her life. (Mom was a powerful force in Harlow's life.)Prior to Harlow's death, her husband - who seems to have been a "curious" fellow in his own right -died under unusual circumstances.

questions.text: Thelma Todd was successful in Hollywood in the 1920s and 30s, but died under mysterious circumstances in 1935. Where was her lifeless body found?
questions.explanation:
In a car.

	The cause of death was carbon monoxide poisoning - caused by the runnning of the car's engine running in a closed garage. Again, suicide, accident or murder?

questions.text: Carol Wayne enjoyed a popular run as a "semi-regular" with Johnny Carson on the "Tonight" show in the 1970s. How did she die?
questions.explanation:
Drowning.

	Wayne - whose career faded after her stints with Carson ended - was  found dead floating in the ocean in Mexico in 1985. How did that happen? (She was afraid of the water.)Reminiscent (in some ways) of Natalie Wood.

questions.text: Lana Turner was a huge star in the 1940s and 50s - but had the most dramatic role of her life when she took the stand in the trial of the 1958 murder of her boy friend. What was the outcome of the trial?
questions.explanation:
Justifiable homicide by Turner's daughter.

	The victim, Johnny Stompanato, was apparently not the nicest guy in the world.

questions.text: Inger Stevens had a fine career in the 1960s, but also had some personal problems along the way. She died in 1970. What celebrity may have been the last person to see her alive?
questions.explanation:
Burt Reynolds.

	Reynolds saw her on the night she died. The cause of death was pills -accident, suicide or murder?

questions.text: Joey Heatherton may best be known for her work in the 1960s and '70s. She went through some turbulent times in her career - perhaps first beginning with some bad publicity for her husband at that time. What was he?
questions.explanation:
Professional athlete.

	Lance Rentzel was a wide receiver for the Dallas Cowboys pro footballl team. They married in the late 1960s.

questions.text: Farrah Fawcett received some bad press for a "curious" appearance on what tv show in the 1990s?
questions.explanation:
David Letterman.

	Many thought she was more than a little "spacy" during her appearance on Letterman's show in 1997.

questions.text: Veronica Lake hit quickly in the 40s - and faded quickly. She disappeared from view - and was ultimately discovered earning a living with what job?
questions.explanation:
Waitress.

	She died young at the age of 54.
